Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay for the price and location”
Reviews.Author: Crunchero
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our time at the hotel, the staff was friendly and the room clean. We were upgraded when we arrived to the large apartment that was big enough for 6 people. The hotel is in a good location off rembrandtplatz, but this is a bit of a party area so can get a bit noisy at night, but we always travel with ear plugs. Overall we would recommend this hotel as a budget option close to all amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad place to stay”
Reviews.Author: C K Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights at a cost of â‚¬540. The location was fantastic, the 24 hour reception was ideal and the service was exceptional. The only downfall was the noise level from outside. We had many disturbances throughout each night which meant we did not get one good night sleep. Apart from that this hotel is very good!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and cheerful but excellent value for money.”
Reviews.Author: MrsMuriachi
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the City Hotel for 4 nights over Christmas 2011. It's right beside Rembrandt Square, close to lots of restaurants, shops and a variety of 'coffee shops' and a short walk to Dam Square. We loved this hotel and have just booked to return in April. It's basic but clean and the staff were always friendly and helpful. I saw no evidence of any of the negative comments made in earlier reviews so don't let them concern you. If you're looking for something cheap and cheerful, with smoking allowed, close to all possible entertainment then I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for some....just not me”
Reviews.Author: weepinwillow
Reviews.Content: First..the good..The staff and the location, and i will even say the cleanliness..The bad..those STAIRS...uggh..I think 87 steps to our room..which at the end of a long day in Amsterdam is quite challenging..at my age..also, if you are a big partier you will love the atmosphere of Rembrandt Square, but..I am not ..so it wasnt the best area for our romantic getaway..My husband and I stayed at City Hotel on our honeymoon and thought it would be fun to go back..it was fun..but I am older and more fussy now so I think future trips will require an elevator at my Amsterdam hotel .

Reviews.Title: “Very poor hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tinkerboy
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 3 nights and hated it. It was very, very noisy and cramped. We had to check in with the hotel reception every time we came back from a walk or forgot something in the room. We asked beforehand if there was an iron and they said there was, but when we needed it and could we bring it to our room, we had a quick and flat "No", they said we had to iron our clothes in the dining room when people were having their breakfast!! I was so embarrassed, I couldn't be bothered in ironing again and had to spend most of my break in wrinkled clothes. Another thing was, our safe was broken and was quite uneasy leaving our valuables in the hotel. Never, ever again! AVOID!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a boys weekend”
Reviews.Author: Doooozie
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in September for a boys weekend in Amsterdam. We were in the room at the very top of the stairs..... Geez, those stairs !!!! This hotel is perfect for a lads weekend where all that is needed is a bed a bog and a shower. There were clean towels every day and the rooms were clean if a little dated. The Staff were very friendly and helpfull. I would stay here again but not in the room at the top....

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: Margot81
Reviews.Content: We shared a comfortable family room for 5 (3 beds and 1 bunk) - tough to find in Amsterdam. Typical steep stairs to our 1st floor room but my 78 year old mum could handle them. Room needs serious redecorating and better lighting but it was clean with comfortable mattresses. The shared bathrooms were spotless and had a great shower. The location is fantastic. The hotel is on the corner of a busy square full of life, reasonably-priced restaurants and across the street from the coolest grocery store in the world. Walking distance to Amsterdam's tourist attractions and an easy tram straight to Centraal station. We found the hotel staff charming and helpful with no problems using our credit card. Overall, an excellent value for the budget traveller.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel out of months of traveling.”
Reviews.Author: feleenie
Reviews.Content: Where to begin? When we arrived we were greeted by a very difficult man working the desk who was either lying and trying to steal our cash or just plain misinformed and unhelpful. We had prepaid online with out credit card but he denied this and demanded cash stating that they only took cash and were to go to the ATM. Using the computer in the lobby I pulled up their website showing that they do take Visa. I also printed out my booking receipt which he said was not valid!!!? There were also other peoples credit card slips with the full name and numbers sprawled out all over the table. So he was obviously lying. And of course this is very personal info to have displayed for all to see. On top of this my fiancee and I were put in bunk beds! Not what the picture showed or was informed of. And the beds are poor quality metal and broken. Both of the beds were bent and we had to put the mattresses on the floor just to avoid pain. Linens smelled and the housekeeping only dumped off clean towels, nothing else. Also, you must check your key in and out every time you leave which made us very nervous being that a very suspicious person was left to work the desk. This place is a dump and WAY overpriced. The Wifi was poor and rarely worked. The only thing good about it is the location.

Reviews.Title: “It's a long way to the top”
Reviews.Author: Kirt2112
Reviews.Content: We had the room at the top of the building, so there many narrow steps to the top. Room was dated, but comfortable. Excellent location. Rembrandt (Pliene) Square is cool, and not as crowded as other places in Amsterdam. The English pub below the hotel has great food, and great service. The hotel staff was helpful, and very cordial.

Reviews.Title: “quality cheap hotel”
Reviews.Author: MichaelS234
Reviews.Content: cheap at about 80 euros for two nights,clean rooms friendly staff,breakfast included. smoker friendly,2mins to nearest coffie shop,and 10 min walk to red light district

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: Travelingkind
Reviews.Content: The location of his hotel is great. It's near the train station, but that's about all. The rooms are tiny with no room for your luggage but in-between the beds in the room. The hotel is noisy especially when the night crowd comes in for the night, waking everybody up in the early hours. We had the basement rooms, not by our choice but the price we paid that's what you got. When people went up and down the stairs it was very noisy. We paid 520.00 euros for 2 rooms for 2 nights. It was a 2 star hotel but I would give it a 1 star. WE chose this hotel for the convience of being near Central station, otherwise I would have stayed a few miles out of town at a better hotel. The staff tho are fantastic. Very helpful, very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Very good, but very basic.”
Reviews.Author: xsoph14x
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in Nov 2008 for 6 nights, found the hotel fairly easily on the Rembrantplein, be warned travellers with heavy cases the stairs up to the hotel reception are extremely steep! Staff all very friendly and helpful, we were asked to leave our room key in reception whenever we left which was fine, as desk was manned 24hrs. Yet more steps up to the room, luckily we were on the first floor so not too much of a treck. Room very basic, but clean and tidy, bed comfy and a double bed aswell, which are quite hard to come accross in amsterdam normally two singles together so very pleased with that,bathroom small and tidy. Clean towels every day, staff would never try to come in if we were still in the room, always passed towels over the door, which was nice as some cleaners can be a bit invading. Never made it to breakfast, so cant comment on that. Did get a pot of tea one morning which they charged for. Only downside, was that we were facing a building that was having construction work done, so very noisy in mornings. However when we stayed in 2009 there was more work being done in the middle of Rembrantplein, so generally I dont think you can escape it if you want to stay in that area. Overall very good stay, hotel was everything we wanted, clean, tidy, double bed, and smoking room (in 2008, although I shouldnt imagine much has changed). If you want somewhere posh, stay clear, if you just want a good nights sleep in a clean environment for fairly cheap, great hotel. Shop around though, hotel is not worth as much as some companies would like you to pay to book there. Also when booking be very careful which City Hotel you are booking at, this is the one on Utrechtsestraat, Rembrantplein, NOT the one near Dam square.

Reviews.Title: “Stingy City Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: park00
Reviews.Content: The staffs are very kind but hotels rooms are very simply decorated. The stair is high, steep and narrow. Somewhere you may knock your head against the roof. It is not suitable to the traveller with children or luggage, neither nor to the old, weak people. The worst thing is the hotel owner who is rather old woman is very stingy. For example, Everyone can only get one boiled egg at hotelâ€™s simple breakfast. There is no milk or yoghourt etc. to the breakfast. The water from the tap is charged. You have to be careful when she look at you and smile because she is just thinking how she can find a way to charge you. For example, you can be charged 2 euro for en cup of hot water ( N.B. It is only from tap water, not mineral water). We will never come back to this hotel because it is too difficult to deal with her. You can understand why it is, she has got more than 1100 euro payment from us and she will even earn a few more euros from tap water. She is the worst niggard we have seen. We suggest her to go to another hotel to learn how to service hotel guests. There are at least 3 or 4 hotels at the same area, we regret why we choose this grudging City Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “****”
Reviews.Author: AnaCaldas
Reviews.Content: Great location, clean, nice staff, breakfast! Had a great time!

Reviews.Title: “City Hotel Rembrandtplein”
Reviews.Author: shaz_spikeuk
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel when I was already in Amsterdam after arriving with no where to stay. Ok for groups of young people as there were clubs and pubs all around that came alive as night fell. Stopped in a two bedroomed apartment, clean but tired, dated, scruffy and nothing like the pictures on the website. Think there are 2 City Hotels (at least) so take care when booking! The staff though were first rate and helpful, breakfast was also great. But there are nicer and cheaper places to stop

Reviews.Title: “perfect..................”
Reviews.Author: colin126
Reviews.Content: stayed at this hotel three times,and will be no doubt staying at it for another three times......location is perfect,,only 5 mins walk and your in thje red light,,"if your into that!"..if you stay in amsterdam its very wise not to stay in the red light,,noise doesnt bother me at night,but in the RLD its non stop..so this hotel is perfect,,close to the happening places,,but just far enough away to get a good kip.....breakfast was good,,,so in all,i dont have a bad word to say about it,,thats why il always go there when i visit amsterdam...........

Reviews.Title: “after reading the bad reviews I was relieved”
Reviews.Author: pippa03
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from Amsterdam and had a very pleasent stay. I was most relieved after reading quite a few bad reviews. It was everything we wanted good location extreamly close to train station. I can not rate the staff more highly they were friendly and most helpfull we arived early morning and was not expecting our room to be ready untill 1.00 how ever the man said he would get it cleaned and ready for us straight away and within half an hour we were in our room. We had clean towls everyday the room was fine clean, tv and good working shower pleanty of hot water. The stair were ok a little steep with small steps but I found these kind of stairs every where in Amsterdam its just how they are there. There was somebody on reception 24 hours a day. I would not hesitate to recomend this hotel to any one.

Reviews.Title: “Its A Bed !!!!”
Reviews.Author: garfthelarf
Reviews.Content: Only stayed one night, quiet close to the Red Light District etc. OK for a lads break but wouldnt advise staying there as part of a couple, theres much better vaule for money in Amsterdam for that. Easy to find Hotel, come out of Amsterdam Central Stion, cross main road, turn left & keep walking, you cant miss it

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Unit504
Reviews.Content: i and a few mates stayed here for 4 nights, we found it a great central location with access to all shops, clubs, bars etc. Stairs where a bit daunting. Staff we found was very helpful and polite As this was our first trip to amsterdam we didnt know what to expect, but we was very pleased with the whole trip overall!

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive Accomodations in Good Location”
Reviews.Author: lilgirl1279
Reviews.Content: This hotel had a good, central location. The hotel attendant was very nice and helpful in suggesting how to get around. The room accomodation was sufficient for what we needed (a place to crash after a night of partying) and had a nice view of the Heineken horses in the AM. The Old Bell Pub (below the hotel) had great beer. I was a little skeptical about the rule that you have to leave your room key with the attendant and ring a bell to get in & out; however, nothing of ours was stolen or missing. The hotel breakfast left something to be desired, but there are enough places to eat within a block or two that it didn't matter. Overall, I would recommend this hotel for someone who is looking for inexpensive accomodations in a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and Cheerful”
Reviews.Author: butch_wade
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights in a triple room, with two mates. As mentioned in an earlier review, you have to ascend the staircase of death to get there, Dutch staircases are not for the faint hearted or clumsy! 3 floors later, we arrived at door 11A. When we opened the door, we were confronted with more stairs! This led through a hatch into the roof of the building, where our 3 single beds were waiting. Unlike earlier reviews, the room, sheets and towels were clean. The only problem was the heat on the first afternoon. The breakfast was ok, no problems there either, and we found the reception staff to be quite friendly and reasonably cheerful. The hotel is a budget hotel, and on that basis, we couldn't find anything to complain about, cheap and cheerful really does apply to this place. It's convenient for Centraal Station, and only a few minutes walk to the bars of the RLD. I would never ever dream of staying here with my wife, but for a blokes weekend away, it was ideal, and I'm sure that we will consider it for our next 'jolly boys outing' to the Dam.

Reviews.Title: “The worst 'hotel' I have ever stayed at!!”
Reviews.Author: taverner
Reviews.Content: After paying up front at reception we took our lives in our hands and tackled the 'staircase of death' to the top of the hotel. Our relief at reaching the top was short lived. Outside our room we were met with a broken window, an old vacuum cleaner blocking the door to the room and a smell which is best left undescribed. The room was a 'quadruple'. It would have suited 4 dwarves at a push (provided they didn't mind the filthy 'bathroom' (no shower curtain) the smell of damp and the dirty bed linen. There was what appeared to be dried blood on the base of one of the beds and graffiti carved on the wall (nice!) The staff were completely disinterested when we pointed out (politely) that the 'hotel' was little more than a 'squat' and wanted the rooms cleaned, shower curtain put in and broken glass in the window replaced (or at the least boarded up). This hotel should carry a govenment health warning.

Reviews.Title: “Central, affordable and friendly”
Reviews.Author: GreenTravelCat
Reviews.Content: Just returend from a 5-days Amsterdam trip together with my boyfriend. We had no problems at all while staying at the City Hotel (Utrechtsestr 2, above The Old Bell). Rooms were clean and spacious, so were bathroom and all other facilities. Breakfast buffet was opulent and staff were friendly and helpful. Previous comments about stolen items were probably written with regard to the "other" City Hotel in Prins Hendrikkade. We had no problems whatsoever with theft, broken doors If anything, earplugs proved to be essential due to the hotel location on Rembrandtplein, where nightlife rocks. During future stays in Amsterdam we'd absolutely stay at the City Hotel again and have no problems recommending it to anyone who's searching for an affordable, safe and clean place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Would go back again”
Reviews.Author: Crawcrook
Reviews.Content: We just stayed here for four nights and I would have no problem recommending this place to my friends. The room was a bit small but newly decorated and clean. Clean sheets every day. Breakfast was buffet but fine for us. If you are like us and spend most of your time out and want a safe, secure (our bedroom had its own free safe!) and clean place to wash and sleep then this is for you. Great location with lots of bars and places to eat but just far enough away (10 minute walk) from the madness of the Red light area to avoid the" oddballs" If you have a problem with stairs look elsewhere otherwise I found it a clean modern small hotel with friendly staff and will stay there again the next time I am back.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of Stairs”
Reviews.Author: TravelBoise
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a good bargain for Amsterdam. They are roomy rooms and are clean. The best thing about the hotel is the location. It is located on Rembrandtplein in the heart of the city. You can walk to the Central Station and most of the areas are reachable by foot or tram. The tram stops right in front of the hotel. There are many great restaurants, literally, right outside the hotel door. The staff was friendly and very helpful. The only complaint I would have are the stairs. We stayed in the quad room which was on the fourth floor with no elevator. It is not where you would want to stay if you are elderly or infirmed. To haul the suitcases up was quite difficult, not for the faint of heart or the unfit person. Overall, I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A joy to stay in time & time again”
Reviews.Author: Bernies Girl
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner recently spent 2 nights in the City Hotel in Amsterdam. The hotel is situated above the Old Bell Pub and is in the centre of Rembrandsplein which is a pretty little square surrounded by pubs, restaurants and a few coffee shops. It is only 5 minutes on the tram from Central Station or 10 minutes on foot. The hotel itself is clean, modern and the staff are nice and freindly. The hotel is open 24 hour so you can stay out to the wee hours without having to worry. The rooms are spacious & clean and come with tv's and plenty of wardrobe space. Towels are also provided. The buffet breakfast is very simple but ideal for grabbing something quick before you head out. We have stayed in this hotel several times now and it is a great place for couples and large groups of friends to stay.

Reviews.Title: “No problems”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Having read all the reviews before we went to (and after i had booked )the City Hotel. I was wondering what i had let me and my mates into....... Me and 6 friends have just got back, we had 7 persons in one room very comfortable. The Hotel staff were verry friendly and helpfull (booking taxi's alarm calls etc). No one had any thing stolen,nothing was broken, room was clean and tidy showers hot and refreshing. The Hotel has 24hr security & reception. The location was ideal for us (not our first visit) All in for what we paid we couldn't (and didn't) complain. My only gripe would have been the baseline window (ill fitting glass vibrated to the music outside). I personally would go back to the City-Hotel (above the Old Bell Pub).

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Hotel! City Hotel Utrechtsestraat, over The Old Bell”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My buddy and I wake up and go get some breakfast the first morning of our trip. We come back inside and the lady that owns the place is going through our bags looking for? She said she was looking for our passports so she could photocopy them because there were "reports" of "noises" coming from our room the night before. Bull-----!!! If I didnt hide all our valuable ---- beforehand who knows what she couldve made off with, regardless we argued with the lady for an hour, she called the Dutch Cops on us, they came, we explained our side, we got some of our money back then stayed at the Jolly Carlton down the street. I suggest the latter, the first hotel was nasty, and there was dried blood all over the underside of one of the matresses.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: No problems with this hotel, well worth the rate - clean, a nice little bar/restaurant area. Great location just off Rembrantplein. Our room was fine, table and chairs + double bed as asked, small but smart shower room ensuite. Breakfast is a bit poor - but if you like ham and cheese butties and boiled eggs you'll love it. (fry up man myself!) The security is spot on - buzzer and intercom entry downstairs and to the rooms. Perfect for young couples and groups, not really for families and older more refined guests. Mashed on night 2 and felt very chilled in room while we came round, so that'll do for me, but aksed for an alarm call and he was 20 mins late, otherwise recommended.

Reviews.Title: “above the old bell”
Reviews.Author: Nick_King
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great! not sure about the reviews below, but me and 5 mates stayed there for 3 nights and found it perfect for exploring amsterdam. friendly staff happy to accomadate to your needs, even gave us a free beer on arrival! the room was clean, showers were hot and a nice location. so you cant really complain! possibly not for families, but is certainly a good hotel for groups of friends!

Reviews.Title: “The Same Place - Above The Old Bell Pub???”
Reviews.Author: RoadLite
Reviews.Content: I've just read the previous reviews with interest - my friends and I stayed at the City Hotel in 2001, it's above the Old Bell Pub on Rembrandtplein. We found it clean and comfortable at the time - if it's the same place it must have gone right down hill (new ownership?). The place we stayed had a ground-floor entrance on a buzzer with video entry by the reception, rooms were all 1st floor or above. I really can't believe this place would have "doors kicked in" - the escape route would be terrible... Hmmm, I do recall my friends, with whom I met up with, were taken by their taxi driver to 2 other places called "The City Hotel" before getting to the right one... Are other reviewers confused. A quick goooogle and I've found an alternative place with the same name already - If you're staying at the place above the Old Bell pub you'll be ok!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in August 2004 and had a terrible experience. The 2 rooms we had were very simple and quite dirty, but it was cheap so we didn't mind that too much. What we did mind was that my friend had all his valuables stolen from the room on our first night and that I got electrocuted by the exposed plug socket under the light switch. Also the hotel's "central location" is quite an exaggeration.

Reviews.Title: “terrible hotel , terrible staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: robbers !!! I do not want to blame someone without clear evidences. but due to the their behaviors and threats, they are the one. At the last week of August , the door kicked and all my valuables gone. This hotel and their extremly helpful (!) staff really suck Never and never go there, even pass trough their street.

Reviews.Title: “hated the city hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: we should have stayed from the 30th july till the 1st of aug but when we got there the place was grotty but three lads did not mind roughing it the rooms were dirty toilets were disgusting we all had a shower each then went out when we returned after only being gone only fifteen minutes to find the door had been kicked in and all our possessions gone i will never return and advise anybody to seriously think twice about staying here because the hotel management certainly knows who did the robbery even the police agreed

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I styed here in June 2003 and I have to say that the location was perfect, walking distance to everything. The staff were really friendly. Although the room wasn't that clean, there was loads of dust and fluff behind the bed. I would definitely stay here again for a short break, for a longer break, I'd prefer a cleaner room. If you don't like walking up a lot of stairs, I would recommend you ask for a room that isn't on the top floors.

HotelInfo.Name: City Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Utrechtsestraat 2, Amsterdam 1017 VN, The Netherlands
